title: Cat. 73.1  Manao tupapau (She Thinks of the Ghost or The Ghost Thinks of Her), from L’estampe originale, 1894
publication_title: Gauguin Paintings, Sculpture, and Graphic Works at the Art Institute of Chicago
content:
<section class="osci-tk-epub-section tombstone" id="tombstone">Manao tupapau (She Thinks of the Ghost or The Ghost Thinks of Her), from L’estampe originale  
1894  
Lithograph with pen and tusche, brush and tusche wash, lithographic crayon, and incising in black ink on ivory wove paper; 180 × 270 mm (image); 423 × 555 mm (sheet)  
Signed lower right, below image, in pen and black ink: Ep. 34. / Paul Gauguin  
The Art Institute of Chicago, gift of Edward McCormick Blair, 2002.262  
Guérin 50, Kornfeld 23 B  
For the verso, see fig. 73.1.1

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section provenance" id="provenance">Henri M. Petiet (1894–1980), Paris, by 1936.

Howard Putzel (1898–1945), Los Angeles.

Sold by Howard Putzel to Natalie Klebenov (1913–1986), Boston, 1937.

Sold by Natalie Klebenov to Pace Prints, New York, Apr. 29, 1982.

Sold by Pace Prints, New York to Alice Adam Ltd., Chicago, for Edward McCormick Blair (1915–2010), Chicago, Oct. 15, 1982.

Given by Edward McCormick Blair to the Art Institute of Chicago, 2002.

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section exhibitions" id="exhibitions">San Francisco Museum of Art, Paul Gauguin: Exhibition of Paintings and Prints, Sept. 5–Oct. 4, 1936, cat. 30a.

Bar Harbor, Maine, Ethel H. Blum Gallery, College of the Atlantic, From Paradise to Eden: Gauguin in Tahiti, Aug. 10–Sept. 11, 1999, cat. 27.

Art Institute of Chicago, Intimate Encounters: Paul Gauguin and the South Pacific; The Edward McCormick Blair Collection, Sept. 6, 2003–Jan. 11, 2004, cat. 38.

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section references" id="references">San Francisco Museum of Art, Paul Gauguin: Exhibition of Paintings and Prints, exh. cat. (San Francisco Museum of Art, 1936), p. 19, cat. 30a.

Elizabeth Mongan, Eberhard W. Kornfeld, and Harold Joachim, Paul Gauguin: Catalogue Raisonné of His Prints, with assistance of Christine E. Stauffer (Galerie Kornfeld, 1988), p. 118, cat. 23.

Douglas Druick and Peter Zegers, From Paradise to Eden: Gauguin in Tahiti, exh. cat. (College of the Atlantic, Ethel H. Blum Gallery, 1999), p. 10, cat. 27.

Art Institute of Chicago, Intimate Encounters: Paul Gauguin and the South Pacific; The Edward McCormick Blair Collection, exhibition brochure (Art Institute of Chicago, 2003), cat. 38.

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section other_documentation" id="other_documentation">Signed lower right, below image, in pen and black ink: Ep. 34. / Paul Gauguin

Signed on stone, upper left, with brush and black tusche in black: P G O

Inscribed on stone, lower left, with pen and black tusche over brush and black tusche wash in black: Manao tupapau

Inscribed lower right, in graphite: G 50

Inscribed upper left, upside down in graphite: Stair Case

</section><section epub:type="footnotes" id="footnotes">San Francisco Museum of Art, Paul Gauguin: Exhibition of Paintings and Prints, exh. cat. (San Francisco Museum of Art, 1936), p. 19, cat. 30a.

See also Alice Adam Ltd., Chicago, invoice addressed to Edward Blair, Sr., Oct. 19, 1982, curatorial object file, Department of Prints and Drawings, Art Institute of Chicago.
